dk.statsbiblioteket.util.i18n
Class EscapeUTF8Stream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      dk.statsbiblioteket.util.i18n.EscapeUTF8Stream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
@QAInfo(level=PEDANTIC,
        state=QA_NEEDED)
public class EscapeUTF8Stream
extends java.io.InputStream

Class to make on-the-fly escaping of UTF8 to ASCII.. This is needed because the whole Properties/ResourceBundle setup is fundamentally broken, in that it is impossible to handle property files in UTF-8.

See Also:
Translator, ResourceBundle, BundleCache

Method Detail

read

@QAInfo(level=PEDANTIC,
        state=QA_NEEDED)
public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
This reads a character from in through reader. If the character has a value <= 127, it is returned directly. If not, the character is escaped to \\uXXXX as described in http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/second_edition/html/lexical.doc.html#100850 The generated characters are stored until next call to read() and only the first of the generated characters is stored.

Specified by:
read in class java.io.InputStream
Returns:
an integer between 0 and 127 from an escaped ASCII stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the character could not be read.

available

public int available()
              throws java.io.IOException
Overrides:
available in class java.io.InputStream
Returns:
the number of bytes that can be read or skipped. This does not take escaping into account, so the number is <= the actual number of skippable bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - in case of I/O errors.

reset

public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
Reset restores the buffer stored by marking and calls reset on the underlying InputStream.

Overrides:
reset in class java.io.InputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the reset of the position could not be performed.

skip

public long skip(long n)
          throws java.io.IOException
Skip is slow, as it reads bytes sequentially from the underlying InputStream. This is needed due to escaping.

Overrides:
skip in class java.io.InputStream
Parameters:
n - the number of bytes to skip.
Returns:
the actual number of skipped bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occured.
